Package edu.bowdoin.csci.TicketManager.model.command

Class Command

java.lang.Object
edu.bowdoin.csci.TicketManager.model.command.Command
public class Command extends Object
Command objects represent commands/user actions sent from the UI to the model. Commands cause the state of a ticket to update.
Author:
Zeb Becker

  • Constructor Details

    • Command

      public Command(Command.CommandValue c, String ownerId, Command.FeedbackCode feedbackCode, Command.ResolutionCode resolutionCode, Command.CancellationCode cancellationCode, String note)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      c - type of command
      ownerId - String noting who is owns this ticket
      feedbackCode - feedback code (set to null if CommandValue is not FEEDBACK)
      resolutionCode - resolution code (set to null if CommandValue is not RESOLVE)
      cancellationCode - cancellation code (set to null if CommandValue is not CANCEL)
      note - to add to ticket
      Throws:
      Illegal - Argument Exception if any required argument is not valid. Note that the required arguments can change based on the type of CommandValue: If it is Feedback, feedback code is required. If Resolve, resolution code is required. If Cancel, cancellation code is required.

  • Method Details

    • getCommand

      public Command.CommandValue getCommand()
      Get command value
      Returns:
      type of command

    • getOwnerId

      public String getOwnerId()
      Get String ownerId
      Returns:
      ID of owner who is responsible for this ticket

    • getResolutionCode

      public Command.ResolutionCode getResolutionCode()
      get resolution code of this command as type ResolutionCode
      Returns:
      resolution code of command. Null if no active resolution code.

    • getNote

      public String getNote()
      get note as string
      Returns:
      note attached to this command, as a string

    • getFeedbackCode

      public Command.FeedbackCode getFeedbackCode()
      get feedback code of this command as FeedbackCode
      Returns:
      feedback code this command is setting the code of the target ticket to. Null if no active feedback code.

    • getCancellationCode

      public Command.CancellationCode getCancellationCode()
      get cancellation code of this command as CancellationCode
      Returns:
      cancellation code this command is setting the code of the target ticket to. Null if no active cancellation code.
